intro: Stylidium affine var. laxum, commonly known as the slender triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that resemble small triggers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and slender. This species is known for its rapid growth and ability to attract pollinators with its vibrant, colorful blooms.
